docs.snippet: The steamship Karnak arrived here, yesterday morning, from Havana on June 8, and Nasaau, N. P., on the 10th.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA AND NASSAU.; Arrival of the Karnak The Reception of Prince Alfred at the Bahamas Prospect of a Sickly Summer at Havana San Domingo, &c. FROM DEMARARA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Karnak arrived here, yesterday morning, from Havana on June 8, and Nasaau, N. P., on the 10th.

docs.snippet: We have just had a most interesting conversation with Mr. AUGUSTUS HUSSON, who left Pensacola on the 1st of June. He was formerly a machinist at the Minnesota Mine, Lake Superior, and is a reliable gentleman.
docs.lead_paragraph: We have just had a most interesting conversation with Mr. AUGUSTUS HUSSON, who left Pensacola on the 1st of June. He was formerly a machinist at the Minnesota Mine, Lake Superior, and is a reliable gentleman.

headline.main: LOCAL MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; THIS ENCAMPMENTS FORT SCHUYLER. THE JACKSON GUARD. WILLETT'S POINT ENCAMPMENT. CAMP PLYMOUTH A CALL FOR WRITING MATERIALS. CAMP WEED, RIKER'S ISLAND. THE CARL SCHURZ CAVALRY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Col. BAKER's command numbers about 950 men, all of whom, with the exception of two companies, are uniformed with the State regulation of grey, which is at once neat and very serviceable. Five hundred old muskets are now in use for drilling, but the new rifled muskets, or Enfield rifles, will be given them.

docs.snippet: A real, but not very formidable specimen of a privateer, sailing under the pirate flag of the Southern Confederacy, with a letter-of-marque duly signed by JEFF. DAVIS, arrived at this port, yesterday, in charge of Midshipman McCook, and a prize crew...

headline.main: THE FIRST PRIVATEER.; Capture of one of Jeff. Davis' Pirates by the U.S. Brig Perry. Her Arrival at this Port The Crew Prisoners on Board of the Minnesota Narrative of the Pirate's Cruise and Description of the Vessel.

docs.lead_paragraph: A real, but not very formidable specimen of a privateer, sailing under the pirate flag of the Southern Confederacy, with a letter-of-marque duly signed by JEFF. DAVIS, arrived at this port, yesterday, in charge of Midshipman McCook, and a prize crew from the United States steam frigate Minnesota.
